snippet: White House officials took pains to emphasize a “disconnect” between the “rhetoric and action” of North Korea’s leader.
abstract: Obama administration says there is no evidence that North Korean leader Kim Jong-un is mobilizing troops or other military forces for any imminent attack, despite drumbeat of increasingly bellicose threats from country's government.

byline.original: By MARK LANDLER and CHOE SANG-HUN
byline.contributor: Mark Landler reported from Washington, and Choe Sang-hun from Seoul, South Korea. Thom Shanker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: White House officials took pains to emphasize a “disconnect” between the “rhetoric and action” of North Korea’s leader.

headline.seo: White House Sees North Korea Blustering, Not Acting
headline.main: U.S. Sees North Korea Blustering, Not Acting
headline.print_headline: U.S. Sees North Korea Blustering, Not Acting
